newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan airline strike affects 20,000 passengers.
newsitem.headline: Japan airline strike affects 20,000 passengers.

text.p: Pilots of Japan's All Nippon Airways went on strike on Sunday, forcing the airline to cancel 148 flights, about 30 percent of its domestic operations, a company official said.
"Around 3 out of 10 of our internal flights are cut... meaning the flights of around 22,000 passengers have been cancelled," said a spokesman for the airline, Japan's second-largest.
"The situation is under control and our other flights are operating as normal," he said.
The union, representing pilots, co-pilots and flight engineers, is protesting against a new wage and seniority system introduced in April.
At Haneda airport, the main domestic airport for the Tokyo region, special counters were set up for customers whose planes had been grounded because of the strike.
ANA said it is reimbursing customers or providing alternate air travel arrangements.
It is the second time the pilots have staged a walkout in the dispute, although a union spokesman said no more industrial action would be taken this year.
In the larger November strike, 357 flights were cancelled, affecting 60,000 passengers.
